thread.title: Tziporah Malkah eats dinner under bed sheet on I'm A Celeb | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Tziporah Malkah eats dinner under bed sheet on I'm A Celeb | Daily Mail Online

author: Candice Jackson For Daily Mail Australia
title: Tziporah Malkah eats dinner under bed sheet on I'm A Celeb | Daily Mail Online
text: Share 141 shares The strange behaviour did not go unnoticed, with former Bachelor contestant Keira Maguire looking noticeably puzzled. Curiosity got the better of the blonde, as she approached Tziporah and asked: 'Tziporah, what are you doing? Why are you eating under the sheet, babe?' Dinner-time antics: The former model and actress slung a blue blanket over her head as she tucked into the campfire creation Confused: The bizarre act attracted the attention of fellow team-mate and former Bachelor contestant Keira Maguire, who looked noticeably puzzled Unable to wait for a response, Keira anxiously yanked the blanket from Tziporah. In an attempt to defend her table manners, the TV star bluntly stated: 'I don't looking at toxic people when you eat. It is bad for your digestion.' Keira, who thought she was the only person facing Tziporah, exclaimed: 'I'm not toxic.' Tziporah reassured her the comment wasn't aimed at her: 'I know you are not.' 'Why are you eating under the sheet, babe?' Keira's curiosity got the better of her, as she took the sheet of Tziporah's head to question the act 'It's bad for your digestion': Defending her odd choice of table manners, the TV star frankly stated: 'I don't looking at toxic people when you eat. It is bad for your digestion' Tziporah later confided in the jungle diary room to say: 'I have been working on myself for the last, you know, few years, the walls have been coming down, which means that there are some fragile spots now... I'm transitioning at the moment.' She insisted 'everything is so big' in the camp, and referenced an argument she had endured the day prior with model Kris Smith over missing socks. 'There was a sock argument. An argument literally about nothing... Everything small becomes our world. You know, if you can tread lightly, lightly, that is how you avoid conflict,' she added. 'There are some fragile spots now... I'm transitioning at the moment': Tziporah later confided in the jungle diary room about her behaviour in the South African jungle so far However, her own advice hasn't worked well for the star, as she's had numerous arguments with camp-mates on 'playing the victim.' She also had a heated row with Kris earlier in the week, in which she called the English hunk 'anti-Simitic' and a 'chauvinist.' After Keira confronted Tziporah about eating her meal under a woolen cover, she also took to the diary room to express her feelings: 'I think Tziporah is going through her own, um, challenges, and I just... I obviously am aware of that.' I'm A Celebrity... Get Me Out Of Here! returns to Channel Ten on Sunday at 7.30pm 'I think Tziporah is going through her own challenges': Keira acknowledged that Tziporah appeared to be dealing with her own challenges in her own way Read more: Share or comment on this article 141
